Foo Reference Manual

Editorial Note:
Except for this notice, this page is autogenerated by using the command 
perl ../bin/make_figure_list.perl \
   -n programs.html \
   -p index.html \
   -t 'Foo Reference Manual' \
   *.html > figures.html
The perl program searches the argument files for anchors like 
<A NAME=figure_8><STRONG CLASS=figure>foo.bet</STRONG></A>
and produces a page with links to these anchors.

If you have a directory with html files including such anchors, and the files are named foo-1.html, foo-2.html, ... foo-10.html, ... (WebMaker produces such files), then you may benefit from using the command 

perl ../bin/make_figure_list.perl \
   -n programs.html \
   -p index.html \
   -t 'Foo Reference Manual' \
   *-?.html *-??.html > figures.html
which makes sure that single-digit files come before double-digit files.
